points: An electric motor converts electrical energy into mechanical energy.
It works on the principle of magnetic force.
It consists of a rotor and a stator.
It requires a source of electricity to function.
It finds application in various industries.
prompts_for_images: A coil of wire with electric current and a magnet with rotating shaft
A diagram showing the interaction of magnetic fields and forces
An illustration of a rotor and stator components
An electric cable plugged into the motor
Examples of electric motors in household appliances, cars, and industrial machines.
